arts.ttl: Lee Carsley picks out England player who has 'gone up a level' during his time in charge
arts.sum: England’s interim boss Lee Carsley has rounded off his spell at the helm after just one defeat with the Three Lions and has picked out one Premier League star for special praise

arts.ttl: England player ratings: verdict on 5-0 win against Republic of Ireland
arts.sum: Jude Bellingham showed his class in the Nations League again, while Conor Gallagher and Lewis Hall impressed Jordan Pickford (GK): Unlikely to have a quieter evening. Ireland did not manage a shot until it was 4-0. 6 Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Jude Bellingham smiles better in an England shirt thanks to Lee Carsley
arts.sum: The Real Madrid man has thanked the interim boss for making international football more enjoyable.

arts.ttl: Lee Carsley hails England’s new generation as he passes reins to Tuchel
arts.sum: ‘We’ve increased pool of players. Exciting times ahead’ Ireland thrashed 5-0 in interim manager’s final game Lee Carsley predicted that competition for places in Thomas Tuchel’s first squad will be fiercer than ever, after his stint as England’s interim head coach ended with a 5-0 thrashing of the Republic of Ireland in the Nations League. Carsley, who said there was relief at returning to the top tier of the Uefa competition, can take pride in fulfilling his brief before stepping aside for Tuchel in the new year. The 50-year-old has used the Nations League campaign to blood a host of youngsters and the growing talent pool was clear as England, who could begin 2026 World Cup qualifying in March, clinched top spot in Group B2 by demolishing 10-man Ireland. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Roy Keane jokes as future son-in-law Harwood-Bellis scores for England
arts.sum: Taylor Harwood-Bellis is to marry Keane’s daughter Leah Former Ireland midfielder: ‘It is not done and dusted’ Roy Keane has joked his daughter’s engagement to Taylor Harwood-Bellis is “not done and dusted” after the Southampton defender scored on his England debut against the Republic of Ireland. Harwood-Bellis is due to marry Keane’s daughter Leah, but upset his future father-in-law by heading home the final goal of England’s 5-0 thumping over Ireland. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Kane has been the defining player of a successful era but that has run its course | Barney Ronay
arts.sum: England want to win the World Cup in two years’ time. They will not with a centre-forward who can no longer move There was an oddly heartbreaking moment with 87 minutes gone at Wembley, as Harry Kane was put through on goal with a chance to score his second of the night, made all the more tender by the fact he seemed so desperately keen to do exactly that with England already 5-0 up. Mainly it was heartbreaking because of the way Kane reached down to pump the accelerator, and just found nothing, a man suddenly running backwards through time, wind chimes tinkling. The finish was rushed and too close to the goalkeeper. Kane ended up flat on his face. He didn’t stop, passing and pointing and leading this team of tyros to the final whistle. Maybe he can wear his Bobby Charlton top next time and still take all the penalties. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Relieved Carsley preparing 'dossier' for Tuchel takeover
arts.sum: Outgoing England interim boss Lee Carsley will prepare a "dossier" handover for new manager Thomas Tuchel ahead of his appointment on January 1.

arts.ttl: Carsley's mission accomplished as foundations laid for Tuchel
arts.sum: England interim manager Lee Carsley can reflect on a mission accomplished as he lays the foundations for incoming head coach Thomas Tuchel.

arts.ttl: Wembley dugout can be lonely, says Carsley as England spell ends
arts.sum: Lee Carsley says Wembley's dugout can be "a lonely place when you're not winning" as he speaks of his relief at guiding England back to the Nations League's top tier.

arts.ttl: England break national team winning record against Ireland in Lee Carsley's final game
arts.sum: England set a new national team record in Lee Carsley's final game in charge as they thump the Republic of Ireland 5-0 in the UEFA Nations League.
